required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Efficacy, Safety, and Immunogenicity of V260 at Expiry

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to evaluate the safety of the investigational Rotavirus Vaccine and the efficacy to prevent Rotavirus Gastroenteritis.

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is 10 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurence of Clinical Rotavirus Disease Caused by the Composite of the Serotypes Contained Within the Vaccine More Than 14 Days Following the Third Dose.
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least 14 days following the 3rd vaccination
primary_outcome.description: G1, G2, G3, and G4 Serotype Rotavirus Gastroenteritis Cases Occurring at Least 14 Days Postdose 3 Through the First Rotavirus Season Postvaccination in the Per-Protocol Population Using Per-Protocol Case Definition

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With ≥3 Fold Rise in Antibody Titer
secondary_outcome.description: Induction of postdose 3 rotavirus Serum neutralizing antibody (SNA) response (Number of subjects with ≥3 fold rise in antibody titer)

arm_group.arm_group_label: RotaTeq™ at Expiry Potency (≈1.1 x 10^7 IU/Dose)
arm_group.description: Three doses of RotaTeq™ (Rotavirus vaccine, live, oral, pentavalent) administered 28 to 70 days apart.
Placebo matching RotaTeq™ administered 28 to 70 days apart.

intervention.intervention_name: RotaTeq™, rotavirus vaccine, live, oral, pentavalent
intervention.description: Three doses of RotaTeq™ administered 28 to 70 days apart.
intervention.arm_group_label: RotaTeq™ at Expiry Potency (≈1.1 x 10^7 IU/Dose)

intervention.description: Placebo matching RotaTeq™ administered 28 to 70 days apart.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy infants
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of abdominal disorders from a birth defect, intussusception, or abdominal surgery
- Known or suspected problems with immune system
- Fever at time of immunization
- Prior administration of a rotavirus vaccine
- History of known prior rotavirus disease
- Chronic diarrhea, or failure to thrive

reference.citation: Block SL, Vesikari T, Goveia MG, Rivers SB, Adeyi BA, Dallas MJ, Bauder J, Boslego JW, Heaton PM; Pentavalent Rotavirus Vaccine Dose Confirmation Efficacy Study Group. Efficacy, immunogenicity, and safety of a pentavalent human-bovine (WC3) reassortant rotavirus vaccine at the end of shelf life. Pediatrics. 2007 Jan;119(1):11-8.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 30 sites - 27 in the United States, and 3 in Finland from 24-Sep-2002 (first patient in) to 11-Feb-2004 (last dose given). Last subject completed follow-up: 08-Jun-2004. All data corrections applied (Frozen File): 07-Sep-2004
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Excluded from the trial before assignment to groups were patients with: history of congenital abdominal disorders, intussusception, or abdominal surgery; history of known prior rotavirus disease, chronic diarrhea, or failure to thrive.

group.title: RotaTeq™ at Expiry Potency (≈1.1 x 10^7 IU/Dose)
group.description: Three doses of RotaTeq™ (Rotavirus vaccine, live, oral, pentavalent) administered 28 to 70 days apart, with up to 42 days of safety follow-up after each vaccination, and followup for acute gastrointestinal episodes (AGEs) through the first rotavirus season post vaccination.

group.title: Placebo Matching RotaTeq™
group.description: Placebo matching RotaTeq™ administered 28 to 70 days apart, with up to 42 days of safety follow-up after each vaccination and follow-up for acute gastrointestinal episodes (AGEs) through the first rotavirus season post vaccination.

participants_list.participants: Subjects who passed all entry criteria and who were randomized in to the study
Subjects who passed all entry criteria and who were randomized in to the study
Subjects vaccinated and followed up 42 days after each dose, thru 1st rotavirus season post study
Subjects vaccinated and followed up 42 days after each dose, thru 1st rotavirus season post study

group.title: RotaTeq™ at Expiry Potency (≈1.1 x 10^7 IU/Dose)
group.description: Three doses of RotaTeq™ (Rotavirus vaccine, live, oral, pentavalent) administered 28 to 70 days apart, with up to 42 days of safety follow-up after each vaccination, and followup for acute gastrointestinal episodes (AGEs) through the first rotavirus season post vaccination.

group.title: Placebo Matching RotaTeq™
group.description: Placebo matching RotaTeq™ administered 28 to 70 days apart, with up to 42 days of safety follow-up after each vaccination and follow-up for acute gastrointestinal episodes (AGEs) through the first rotavirus season post vaccination.

outcome.title: Occurence of Clinical Rotavirus Disease Caused by the Composite of the Serotypes Contained Within the Vaccine More Than 14 Days Following the Third Dose.
outcome.description: G1, G2, G3, and G4 Serotype Rotavirus Gastroenteritis Cases Occurring at Least 14 Days Postdose 3 Through the First Rotavirus Season Postvaccination in the Per-Protocol Population Using Per-Protocol Case Definition
outcome.time_frame: At least 14 days following the 3rd vaccination
outcome.population: Per Protocol Population; number randomized is different from number analyzed due to some data excluded from the analysis (e.g., unevaluable due to wild-type rotavirus-positive stool antigen Enzyme immunoassay (EIA) prior to 14 days Postdose 3, incomplete clinical and/or laboratory results, or stool samples collected out of day range.

group.title: RotaTeq™ at Expiry Potency (≈1.1 x 107 IU/Dose)
group.description: Three doses of RotaTeq™ (Rotavirus vaccine, live, oral, pentavalent) administered 28 to 70 days apart, with up to 42 days of safety follow-up after each vaccination, and follow-up for acute gastrointestinal episodes (AGEs) through the first rotavirus season post vaccination.

group.title: Placebo Matching RotaTeq™
group.description: Placebo matching RotaTeq™ administered 28 to 70 days apart, with up to 42 days of safety follow-up after each vaccination and follow-up for AGEs through the first rotavirus season post vaccination.

measure.title: Occurence of Clinical Rotavirus Disease Caused by the Composite of the Serotypes Contained Within the Vaccine More Than 14 Days Following the Third Dose.
measure.description: G1, G2, G3, and G4 Serotype Rotavirus Gastroenteritis Cases Occurring at Least 14 Days Postdose 3 Through the First Rotavirus Season Postvaccination in the Per-Protocol Population Using Per-Protocol Case Definition
measure.population: Per Protocol Population; number randomized is different from number analyzed due to some data excluded from the analysis (e.g., unevaluable due to wild-type rotavirus-positive stool antigen Enzyme immunoassay (EIA) prior to 14 days Postdose 3, incomplete clinical and/or laboratory results, or stool samples collected out of day range.

analysis.estimate_desc: Efficacy = 1-RR, expressed as a percentage; the RR is the incidence in the vaccine group / the incidence in the placebo group.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With ≥3 Fold Rise in Antibody Titer
outcome.description: Induction of postdose 3 rotavirus Serum neutralizing antibody (SNA) response (Number of subjects with ≥3 fold rise in antibody titer)
outcome.population: Per Protocol Population; number randomized is different from number analyzed due to some data excluded from the analysis (e.g., unevaluable due to wild-type rotavirus-positive stool antigen EIA prior to 14 days Postdose 3, incomplete clinical and/or laboratory results, or stool samples collected out of day range.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Safety has been reported in the literature.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Vice President, Late Stage Development Group Leader
